intro: Carum grossheimii, commonly known as the Grossheim's caraway, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits called mericarps, which are often used in traditional medicine. Carum grossheimii thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
